A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In the course of her training, the girl meets a charming aristocrat who offers to fix the race for an exorbitant price. The girl decides to accept the terms in order to finance the horse and to pay for a great horse substitute who is a magnificent runner.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, the ideals he pursued and the books, paintings and haiku he made.
Genre: Animation ,  Drama ,  History

This movie is nothing short of a dark, gritty masterpiece. I may be bias, as the Apartheid era is an area I've always felt for South Africa. The problems they have are immense, and only solutions of varying degree are contemplated and implemented. The movie is as dark and depressing as the country was at that time, and continues to be as the restructuring from Apartheid to this new form of political injustice remains blatant by the day, literally.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople are stopping anyone going near the felines, and the cat has developed some black magic.
While the previews for this one and trailers made it look like a cute, funny little creature feature it is actually a far grittier film. While it has elements of humor it is also quite creepy at times
